$eref.description: The most generic type of item. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Thing

___description.description: A short description of the item.

___additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

___image.description: URL of an image of the item.

___sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Organization

$eref.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Place

___location.description: The location of the event, organization or action.

$eref.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Organization

___location.description: The location of the event, organization or action.

___subOrganization.description: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property.

___aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

___contactPoint.description: A contact point for a person or organization. Supersedes contactPoints.

___review.description: Review of the item (legacy spelling; see singular form, review).

___department.description: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

___legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

___brand.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

___founder.description: A person who founded this organization. Supersedes founders.

___subOrganization.description: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property.

$eref.description: The average rating based on multiple ratings or reviews. Schema.org: http://schema.org/AggregateRating

___reviewCount.description: The count of total number of reviews.

___itemReviewed.description: The item that is being reviewed/rated.

___ratingCount.description: The count of total number of ratings.

___aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

$eref.description: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department. Schema.org: http://schema.org/ContactPoint

___contactType.description: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

___availableLanguage.description: A language someone may use with the item.

___productSupported.description: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. 'iPhone') or a general category of products or services (e.g. 'smartphones').

___contactPoint.description: A contact point for a person or organization. Supersedes contactPoints.

___review.description: Review of the item (legacy spelling; see singular form, review).

$eref.description: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Review

___itemReviewed.description: The item that is being reviewed/rated.

___reviewBody.description: The actual body of the review.

___reviewRating.description: The rating given in this review. Note that reviews can themselves be rated. The reviewRating applies to rating given by the review. The aggregateRating property applies to the review itself, as a creative work.

$eref.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Organization

___location.description: The location of the event, organization or action.

___subOrganization.description: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property.

___aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

___contactPoint.description: A contact point for a person or organization. Supersedes contactPoints.

___review.description: Review of the item (legacy spelling; see singular form, review).

___department.description: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

___legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

___brand.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

___founder.description: A person who founded this organization. Supersedes founders.

___department.description: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

___legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

$eref.description: A brand is a name used by an organization or business person for labeling a product, product group, or similar. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Brand

___brand.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

$eref.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional). Schema.org: http://schema.org/Person

___contactPoint.description: A contact point for a person or organization. Supercedes contactPoints.

___honorificSuffix.description: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.

___worksFor.description: Organizations that the person works for.

___parent.description: A parent of this person. Supercedes parents.

___familyName.description: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the Name property.

___affiliation.description: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

___givenName.description: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the Name property.

___follow.description: The most generic uni-directional social relation.

___honorificPrefix.description: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

___award.description: An award won by this person or for this creative work. Supercedes awards.

___additionalName.description: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

___jobTitle.description: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

___memberOf.description: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs. Inverse property: member.

___founder.description: A person who founded this organization. Supersedes founders.
